perturbation.original_text: Section 1.2 Integrity agrees to use its best efforts to solicit orders for the sale of the Shares at the public offering price, as determined in accordance with the Registration Statement, and will undertake such advertising and promotion as it believes is reasonable in connection with such solicitation. Integrity shall order Shares from the Fund only to the extent that it shall have received purchase orders therefore.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 1.2 Integrity agrees to use its good faith efforts to solicit orders for the sale of the Shares at a price it considers appropriate, and will undertake advertising and promotion as it deems suitable. Integrity may order Shares from the Fund based on anticipated demand.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'best efforts' to 'good faith efforts' and 'public offering price' to 'price it considers appropriate' introduces ambiguity. Allowing Integrity to order shares based on 'anticipated demand' instead of only 'purchase orders' contradicts SEC regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: SEC Rule 22c-1 under the Investment Company Act of 1940
perturbation.law_explanation: Rule 22c-1 requires that mutual fund shares be sold at a price based on the current net asset value (NAV) calculated shortly before the order is executed. Allowing Integrity to sell at a price it 'considers appropriate' and order shares based on 'anticipated demand' circumvents this pricing rule, potentially leading to dilution or unfair pricing for investors.

perturbation.original_text: Section 1.3 All activities by Integrity as underwriter of the Shares shall comply with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations, including, without limitation, all rules and regulations made or adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") or by any securities association registered under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the Fund's Registration Statement.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 1.3 Integrity will generally aim to conduct its activities as underwriter of the Shares in a manner that it believes is consistent with applicable laws, rules, and regulations. The specifics of compliance with regulations from the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) or registered securities associations will be assessed periodically.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall comply' with 'will generally aim to conduct... in a manner that it believes is consistent with' creates a weaker obligation. The phrase 'assessed periodically' introduces vagueness regarding the frequency and rigor of compliance checks. This is inconsistent with requirements of the Securities Exchange Act.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 15(c) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934
perturbation.law_explanation: Section 15(c) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 prohibits broker-dealers from engaging in fraudulent, manipulative, or deceptive practices and requires them to comply with SEC rules and regulations. The modified text's ambiguous commitment to compliance undermines the broker-dealer's obligation to strictly adhere to these regulations, potentially enabling practices that violate investor protection laws.

perturbation.original_text: Section 3.1 The Fund represents to Integrity that all registration statements, prospectuses, and statements of additional information filed by the Fund with the SEC under the 1933 Act and the 1940 Act with respect to the Shares of the Fund have been carefully prepared in conformity with the requirements of the 1933 Act, the 1940 Act, and the rules and regulations of the SEC thereunder. As used in this Agreement, the terms "registration statement," "prospectus," and "statement of additional information" shall mean any registration statement, prospectus, and statement of additional information filed by the Fund with the SEC and any amendments and supplements thereto which at any time shall have been filed with the SEC. The Fund represents and warrants to Integrity that any registration statement, prospectus, and statement of additional information, when such registration statement becomes effective, will include all statements required to be contained therein in conformity with the 1933 Act, the 1940 Act, and the rules and regulations of the SEC; that all statements of fact contained in any registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information will be true and correct when such registration statement becomes effective; and that neither any registration statement nor any prospectus or statement of additional information when such registration statement becomes effective will include an untrue statement of material fact or omit to state a material fact required to be stated therein or necessary to make the statements therein not misleading to a purchaser of Shares.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 3.1 The Fund believes that all registration statements, prospectuses, and statements of additional information filed by the Fund with the SEC under the 1933 Act and the 1940 Act with respect to the Shares of the Fund have been prepared with reasonable effort to conform to the requirements of the 1933 Act, the 1940 Act, and the rules and regulations of the SEC thereunder. The Fund believes and represents that any registration statement, prospectus, and statement of additional information, when such registration statement becomes effective, will generally include statements. The fund makes a good faith effort to ensure accuracy, but does not guarantee all statements of fact contained in any registration statement, prospectus, or statement of additional information will be entirely true and correct when such registration statement becomes effective; and that the fund plans on neither any registration statement nor any prospectus or statement of additional information including an untrue statement of material fact or omitting to state a material fact required to be stated therein or necessary to make the statements therein not misleading to a purchaser of Shares.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'represents' to 'believes' and 'carefully prepared in conformity' to 'prepared with reasonable effort to conform' weakens the representation and warranty. Adding 'generally include' creates uncertainty. Stating that it 'does not guarantee' truth and correctness, while stating that they 'plan on' not including untrue statements further dilutes the accountability of the Fund for its filings with the SEC.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 11 of the Securities Act of 1933
perturbation.law_explanation: Section 11 imposes strict liability on issuers and underwriters for material misstatements or omissions in registration statements. By weakening its representation and warranty regarding the accuracy and completeness of its filings, the Fund attempts to limit its liability under Section 11, which is not permissible. The standard of liability under Section 11 is strict, and cannot be contracted away by vague or qualified representations.
